          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      rakina@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/444592569" title="rakina@chromium.org"><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></a>
      rakina@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -> MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (<object> element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -&gt; MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (&lt;object&gt; element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<!----></span><br><br>I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<span class="line"><!---->I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/4273107<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4273107"><!---->crrev.com/c/4273107<!----></a> to fix them.<span class="line"><!----> to fix them.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<span class="line"><!---->Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<span class="line"><!---->The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<!----></span><br><br>This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<span class="line"><!---->This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a>) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <span class="line"><!---->) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<span class="line"><!----> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  // The renderer had indicated that the navigation cancellation window had<span class="line"><!---->  // The renderer had indicated that the navigation cancellation window had<!----></span><br>  // ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<span class="line"><!---->  // ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<!----></span><br>  // signal.<span class="line"><!---->  // signal.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = true;<!----></span><br>  if (renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_) {<!----></span><br>    std::move(renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_).Run();  // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_).Run();  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<!----></span><br>            ->renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<!----></span><br>  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<!----></span><br>  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<span class="line"><!---->  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<!----></span><br>  request->GetRenderFrameHost()->GetRenderWidgetHost()->RendererIsResponsive();<span class="line"><!---->  request-&gt;GetRenderFrameHost()-&gt;GetRenderWidgetHost()-&gt;RendererIsResponsive();<!----></span><br><br>  Resume();  // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Resume();  // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void PrerenderSubframeNavigationThrottle::DidFinishNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->void           Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      rakina@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/444592569" title="rakina@chromium.org"><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></a>
      rakina@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -> MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (<object> element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -&gt; MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (&lt;object&gt; element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<!----></span><br><br>I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<span class="line"><!---->I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/4273107<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4273107"><!---->crrev.com/c/4273107<!----></a> to fix them.<span class="line"><!----> to fix them.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<span class="line"><!---->Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<span class="line"><!---->The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<!----></span><br><br>This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<span class="line"><!---->This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a>) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <span class="line"><!---->) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<span class="line"><!----> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  // The renderer had indicated that the navigation cancellation window had<span class="line"><!---->  // The renderer had indicated that the navigation cancellation window had<!----></span><br>  // ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<span class="line"><!---->  // ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<!----></span><br>  // signal.<span class="line"><!---->  // signal.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = true;<!----></span><br>  if (renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_) {<!----></span><br>    std::move(renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_).Run();  // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_).Run();  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<!----></span><br>            ->renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<!----></span><br>  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<!----></span><br>  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<span class="line"><!---->  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<!----></span><br>  request->GetRenderFrameHost()->GetRenderWidgetHost()->RendererIsResponsive();<span class="line"><!---->  request-&gt;GetRenderFrameHost()-&gt;GetRenderWidgetHost()-&gt;RendererIsResponsive();<!----></span><br><br>  Resume();  // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Resume();  // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void PrerenderSubframeNavigationThrottle::DidFinishNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->void PrerenderSubframeNavigationThrottle::DidFinishNavigation(<!----></span><br>    NavigationHandle* nav_handle) {<span class="line"><!---->    NavigationHandle* nav_handle) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  // Resume the subframe navigation.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resume the subframe navigation.<!----></span><br>  if (!is_deferred_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!is_deferred_)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  is_deferred_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->  is_deferred_ = false;<!----></span><br>  Resume();<span class="line"><!---->  Resume();<!----></span><br>  // Resume() may have deleted `this`.  // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->  // Resume() may have deleted `this`.  // ===&gt; [4]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1]         Thank you for your report. This report does not contain enough technical information sufficient to be considered to demonstrate exploitability or security consequences. <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for your report. This report does not contain enough technical information sufficient to be considered to demonstrate exploitability or security consequences. <!----></span><br><br>Without further actionable information (e.g. POC / reproduction steps / symbolized stack trace), the Chrome Security team is unable to reproduce this bug. We do not have definite evidence that this bug is a reachable, exploitable security bug in Chrome and we need your help to assess.<span class="line"><!---->Without further actionable information (e.g. POC / reproduction steps / symbolized stack trace), the Chrome Security team is unable to reproduce this bug. We do not have definite evidence that this bug is a reachable, exploitable security bug in Chrome and we need your help to assess.<!----></span><br><br>rakina@, can you briefly review this issue, and if possible, provide a comment explaining whether you believe this condition can be achieved in a production version of Chrome? It would also be helpful to know if you think this is a recent regression or not. If you believe this issue is real, please prioritize a fix.<span class="line"><!---->rakina@, can you briefly review this issue, and if possible, provide a comment explaining whether you believe this condition can be achieved in a production version of Chrome? It would also be helpful to know if you think this is a recent regression or not. If you believe this issue is real, please prioritize a fix.<!----></span><br><br>Note: In case this is a real bug, setting the severity to Critical due to a UAF in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->Note: In case this is a real bug, setting the severity to Critical due to a UAF in the browser process.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      rakina@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/444592569" title="rakina@chromium.org"><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></a>
      rakina@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -> MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (<object> element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -&gt; MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (&lt;object&gt; element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<!----></span><br><br>I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<span class="line"><!---->I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/4273107<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4273107"><!---->crrev.com/c/4273107<!----></a> to fix them.<span class="line"><!----> to fix them.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<span class="line"><!---->Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 8<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;

          margin-top: 1em;

          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<span class="line"><!---->The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<!----></span><br><br>This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<span class="line"><!---->This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a>) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <span class="line"><!---->) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<span class="line"><!----> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  // The renderer had indicated that the navigation cancellation window had<span class="line"><!---->  // The renderer had indicated that the navigation cancellation window had<!----></span><br>  // ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<span class="line"><!---->  // ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<!----></span><br>  // signal.<span class="line"><!---->  // signal.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = true;<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = true;<!----></span><br>  if (renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_) {<span class="line"><!---->  if std::move(renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_).Run();  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<!----></span><br>            ->renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<!----></span><br>  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<!----></span><br>  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<span class="line"><!---->  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<!----></span><br>  request->GetRenderFrameHost()->GetRenderWidgetHost()->RendererIsResponsive();<span class="line"><!---->  request-&gt;GetRenderFrameHost()-&gt;GetRenderWidgetHost()-&gt;RendererIsResponsive();<!----></span><br><br>  Resume();  // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->  Resume();  // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void PrerenderSubframeNavigationThrottle::DidFinishNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->void PrerenderSubframeNavigationThrottle::DidFinishNavigation(<!----></span><br>    NavigationHandle* nav_handle) {<span class="line"><!---->    NavigationHandle* nav_handle) {<!----></span><br>  // skip<span class="line"><!---->  // skip<!----></span><br>  // Resume the subframe navigation.<span class="line"><!---->  // Resume the subframe navigation.<!----></span><br>  if (!is_deferred_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!is_deferred_)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  is_deferred_ = false;<span class="line"><!---->  is_deferred_ = false;<!----></span><br>  Resume();<span class="line"><!---->  Resume();<!----></span><br>  // Resume() may have deleted `this`.  // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->  // Resume() may have deleted         Thank you for your report. This report does not contain enough technical information sufficient to be considered to demonstrate exploitability or security consequences. <!----></span><br><br>Without further actionable information (e.g. POC / reproduction steps / symbolized stack trace), the Chrome Security team is unable to reproduce this bug. We do not have definite evidence that this bug is a reachable, exploitable security bug in Chrome and we need your help to assess.<span class="line"><!---->Without further actionable information (e.g. POC / reproduction steps / symbolized stack trace), the Chrome Security team is unable to reproduce this bug. We do not have definite evidence that this bug is a reachable, exploitable security bug in Chrome and we need your help to assess.<!----></span><br><br>rakina@, can you briefly review this issue, and if possible, provide a comment explaining whether you believe this condition can be achieved in a production version of Chrome? It would also be helpful to know if you think this is a recent regression or not. If you believe this issue is real, please prioritize a fix.<span class="line"><!---->rakina@, can you briefly review this issue, and if possible, provide a comment explaining whether you believe this condition can be achieved in a production version of Chrome?           Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      rakina@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/444592569" title="rakina@chromium.org"><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></a>
      rakina@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->rakina@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Feb 21, 2023, 7:39 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI>Browser>Navigation
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: UAF when code runs after NavigationThrottle's Resume() or CancelDeferredNavigation() are called
          (was: Security: Potential UAF in NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          alex...@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          UI&gt;Browser&gt;Navigation
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -> MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (<object> element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. Yes, I think deletion of the NavigationRequest is possible after we run NavigationThrottle::Resume() if we end up at calling OnRequestFailedInternal() [1] -&gt; MaybeCancelFailedNavigation() [2] which might delete the NavigationRequest, although only in some cases (&lt;object&gt; element and aborted navigations?). There's also NavigationThrottle::CancelDeferredNavigation() which might also result in deletion of the NavigationRequest in the same way.<!----></span><br><br>I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<span class="line"><!---->I audited other usages of Resume() and looks like there are other throttles that still have code after Resume() and CancelDeferredNavigation() calls. I've made<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/4273107<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4273107"><!---->crrev.com/c/4273107<!----></a> to fix them.<span class="line"><!----> to fix them.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<span class="line"><!---->Aside from that, I wonder if there's something that we can do to avoid this problem from happening again in the future. We already have comments about the potential deletions caused by calling these functions both in the method and a lot of the callsites, but that seems easy to overlook/forget. Naming the functions more explicitly (e.g. ResumeMayDeleteThrottle()) might make it more noticeable I guess, but I wonder if we can make something like an automatic (compile-time?) check that ensures these functions are the last things called from the callers..<!----></span><br><br>[1]: <span class="line"><!---->[1]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=4260;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><br>[2]: <span class="line"><!---->[2]: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigation_request.cc;l=8228;drc=d6736f594e04d48d710ef41d24ce85f0e7699335<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 7<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1417133#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rong! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this issue -- the amount was decided based on this issue not being reproducible or demonstrable as exploitable. If this issue were exploitable or someone determined a way to exploit it, it would be seemingly sufficiently impactful but also potentially mitigated; therefore, since the information you provided allowed us to land a patch to prevent this possibility. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this to us!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<span class="line"><!---->The function `NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded` runs the callback renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ at line [1]. And the renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_ is `RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded`, which calls `Resume` at line [2]. Calling `Resume` may delete NavigationRequest synchronously, which result in UAF write at line [3].<!----></span><br><br>This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<span class="line"><!---->This issue is similar to anthter one I reported (<!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a>) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <span class="line"><!---->) -- UAF caused by accessing member variables after calling function `Resume`. According to other callsites of `Resume`, there is code comment saying "Resume() may have deleted `this`." [4], and <!----></span>crbug.com/1417122<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1417122" title="Security:  UAF in PlatformAuthNavigationThrottle::FetchHeadersCallback"><!---->crbug.com/1417122<!----></a> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<span class="line"><!----> provides a PoC to demonstrate it. I didn't construct the PoC for this issue (sorry about that, time limited), so it's just a potential UAF. Feel free to close it if you believe it not a security issue :)<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void NavigationRequest::RendererCancellationWindowEnded() {<span ended, so the navigation can resume if it is currently waiting for this<!----></span><br>  // signal.<span class="line"><!---->  // signal.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_window_ended_ = std::move(renderer_cancellation_window_ended_callback_).Run();  // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_listener_.reset();  // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<span class="line"><!---->void RendererCancellationThrottle::NavigationCancellationWindowEnded() {<!----></span><br>  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<span class="line"><!---->  CHECK(NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle())<!----></span><br>            ->renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<span class="line"><!---->            -&gt;renderer_cancellation_window_ended());<!----></span><br>  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->  // Stop the timeout and notify that renderer is responsive if necessary.<!----></span><br>  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<span class="line"><!---->  renderer_cancellation_timeout_timer_.Stop();<!----></span><br>  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<span class="line"><!---->  NavigationRequest* request = NavigationRequest::From(navigation_handle());<!----></span><br>  request->GetRenderFrameHost()->GetRenderWidgetHost()->RendererIsResponsive();<span class="line"><!---->
